qas.question: What was the primary base of the Royal navy during World War I?
What sorts of ships were based in Davenport?
What location provided a base for flying boats?

context: During the First World War, Plymouth was the port of entry for many troops from around the Empire and also developed as a facility for the manufacture of munitions. Although major units of the Royal Navy moved to the safety of <a0_0>Scapa Flow<a0_0/>, Devonport was an important base for <a1_0>escort vessels<a1_0/> and repairs. Flying boats operated from <a2_0>Mount Batten<a2_0/>.
